page.title: 15BIRDS IN THE MADDERTY AREA
page.content: There is an enormous variety of birds in this area. In the{farmland,}crows, jackdaws,lapwings,oyster-catchers, curlews,fieldfares,seagulls are seen. {In the woods}we see partridge, pheasants,wood-pigeons,collared doves,jays,cuckoos,woodpeckers and tree-creepers. On the{Pow Water,a man-made drainage canal ,mallard ducks,herons and moorhen can be seen.On the{flooded fields}in winter there are large flocks of pink-foot geese. Wild swans winter here too. Of the birds of prey there are owls, kestrels, sparrow-hawks,buzzards and hen-harriers.{In our gardens}are robins,sparrows,blue-tits,thrushes, blackbirds,chaffinches,house-martins, swallows,yellow-hammers,greenfinches, wagtails often visit.
